meanings.definition: A framework of beams or bars used to support a roof or bridge.
meanings.sent1: The truss held up the roof of the barn.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers installed the truss to support the bridge.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ran along the truss, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed under the truss of the old wooden bridge.
meanings.sent5: The truss resembled a giant spider web, connecting the beams together.

meanings.definition: A supportive device worn to reduce strain on an injured body part.
meanings.sent1: The athlete wore a truss on his knee after the injury.
meanings.sent2: She used a truss to support her back while lifting heavy boxes.
meanings.sent3: The truss made him feel like a superhero with a special power belt.
meanings.sent4: Her truss was like a loyal friend, always there to lend support.
meanings.sent5: The truss hugged her injured arm gently, providing comfort and stability.

meanings.definition: To secure tightly with ropes or straps.
meanings.sent1: He needed to truss the luggage securely onto the roof of the car.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to truss the chicken before roasting it.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to truss the audience's attention with his dazzling tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to truss his heart, holding it captive with their sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The vines trussed the tree trunk, creating a natural work of art in the forest.

meanings.definition: A bundle of straw or hay.
meanings.sent1: The farmer carried a truss of hay to feed the horses.
meanings.sent2: She used a truss of straw to create a scarecrow in the field.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids built a truss fort in the barn, hiding from their parents.
meanings.sent4: The truss of hay looked like a cozy nest for the farm animals.
meanings.sent5: The truss of straw rustled in the wind, creating a soothing sound in the countryside.
